abstract: Samuel D. Waksal, the biotechnology executive whose insider trading landed him and his friend Martha Stewart in prison, is trying to make a comeback. His new company, Kadmon Pharmaceuticals, said it had acquired Three Rivers Pharmaceuticals, a privately held company in that mainly sells drugs to treat hepatitis C.

lead_paragraph: Samuel D. Waksal, the biotechnology executive whose insider trading landed him and his friend Martha Stewart in prison, is trying to make a comeback.

headline.main: Former Chief of ImClone Buys a Drug Company
